title: Romanian Social Democratic Party (1990–2001)
text:
The Romanian Social Democratic Party (, PSDR) was a <a href="Social%20democracy">social-democratic</a> <a href="political%20party">political party</a> in <a href="Romania">Romania</a>. Founded in 1990, after the <a href="Romanian%20Revolution%20of%201989">fall of the Communist party rule</a> in Romania, it claimed to be the direct successor of the <a href="Romanian%20Social%20Democratic%20Party%20%281927%E2%80%931948%29">Romanian Social Democratic Party</a> (PSD) existing between 1927 and 1948, when it had merged with the <a href="Romanian%20Communist%20Party">Romanian Communist Party</a> (PCR) to create the <a href="Romanian%20Workers%27%20Party">Romanian Workers' Party</a> (PMR). 
Joining the <a href="Socialist%20International">Socialist International</a>, the party entered alliances with the <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28Romania%29">Democratic Party</a> (PD; forming "Uniunea Social-Democrată" or <a href="Social%20Democratic%20Union%20%28Romania%29">Social Democratic Union</a> during the <a href="1996%20general%20election">1996 legislative election</a>), and took part in the <a href="Romanian%20Democratic%20Convention">Romanian Democratic Convention</a> (CDR) governments of <a href="Victor%20Ciorbea">Victor Ciorbea</a>, <a href="Radu%20Vasile">Radu Vasile</a>, and <a href="Mugur%20Is%C4%83rescu">Mugur Isărescu</a> (briefly leading the <a href="coalition%20government">coalition government</a> with <a href="Alexandru%20Athanasiu">Alexandru Athanasiu</a> as acting/ad interim PM in 1999). The PSDR adhered to the <a href="Social%20Democratic%20Pole%20of%20Romania">Social Democratic Pole of Romania</a> (PDSR), and fused into the <a href="Social%20Democratic%20Party%20%28Romania%29">Social Democratic Party</a> (PSD) on 16 January 2001.
A minority wing opposed to the merger survived as Partidul Social Democrat "Constantin Titel Petrescu", later reforming itself as the Social-Democratic Workers' Party, which was dissolved in 2013.
